## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 907, 571]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 907, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 600, 598, 615]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 615, 608, 630]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 644, 608, 660]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 660, 757, 676]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 676, 440, 691]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
A group consists of 5 men and 2 women. Find the number of different ways that the group can stand in a line if the women are not next to each other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A box contains 3 red balls and 5 blue balls. One ball is taken at random from the box and not replaced. A yellow ball is then put into the box. A second ball is now taken at random from the box.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 120, 156, 138]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 120, 863, 139]]<|/det|>

9709/63/O/N/18

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 728, 92]]<|/det|>
Out of a class of 8 boys and 4 girls, a group of 7 people is chosen at random.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 104, 156, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 104, 695, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the group of 7 includes one particular boy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 156, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 662, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the group of 7 includes at least 2 girls.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The weights of apples sold by a store can be modelled by a normal distribution with mean 120 grams and standard deviation 24 grams. Apples weighing less than 90 grams are graded as 'small'; apples weighing more than 140 grams are graded as 'large'; the remainder are graded as 'medium'.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 136, 156, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
Show that the probability that an apple chosen at random is graded as medium is 0.692, correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 915, 92]]<|/det|>
Four apples are chosen at random. Find the probability that at least two are graded as medium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The lifetimes, in hours, of a particular type of light bulb are normally distributed with mean 2000 hours and standard deviation \(\sigma\) hours. The probability that a randomly chosen light bulb of this type has a lifetime of more than 1800 hours is 0.96.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 135, 156, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 135, 316, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\sigma\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
New technology has resulted in a new type of light bulb. It is found that on average one in five of these new light bulbs has a lifetime of more than 2500 hours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 120, 154, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 120, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
For a random selection of 300 of these new light bulbs, use a suitable approximate distribution to find the probability that fewer than 70 have a lifetime of more than 2500 hours. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 735, 185, 753]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 735, 628, 755]]<|/det|>
Justify the use of your approximate distribution in part (ii).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 736, 917, 755]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
The heights of the 11 members of the Anvils are denoted by \(x \text{cm}\). It is given that \(\Sigma x = 1923\) and \(\Sigma x^2 = 337 221\). The Anvils are joined by 3 new members whose heights are \(166 \text{cm}\), \(172 \text{cm}\) and \(182 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 151, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 135, 751, 155]]<|/det|>
Find the standard deviation of the heights of all 14 members of the Anvils.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
